sen.j: 七条新地（しちじょうしんち）はかつて、京都市下京区に存在した遊廓であり、現在は『五条楽園』（ごじょうらくえん）と名称を変えて営業している。
sen.e: Shichijo-shinchi was once a brothel in Shimogyo Ward, Kyoto City and today it continues its business under its new name, "Gojo Rakuen."

sen.j: 江戸時代中期、河原の畑地を開墾して煮売り茶屋を開いたことから遊廓の始まりだといわれている。
sen.e: It was said that Shichijo-shinchi brothel was originally a chaya (teahouse) of boiled foods founded on the land reclaimed from the riverside fields in the middle of the Edo period.

sen.e: It flourished as the biggest brothel in Kyoto during the later Edo period and Meiji period and in Taisho period it owned rows of three-storey buildings.

sen.e: After the World War II, Shichijo-shinchi was designated as the red-light district and closed down in 1958 when Anti-Prostitution Law took effect.
